blocks.content: Faced with the rising cost of basic shared hosting (like BlueHost), I built a lightweight WordPress replacement from scratch using React, TypeScript, and Vite. The result is a fast, modular, and fully client-side framework hosted on GitHub Pages — no server required.

This project was a deep dive into static site generation, routing, and component-based architecture. It supports blog-style content, dynamic navigation, and responsive design, all without the overhead of traditional CMS platforms. It's lean, scalable, and tailored to my exact needs — a satisfying blend of cost-efficiency and creative control.
You're using it right now! This website is built with the same framework, showcasing its capabilities in real-time.
